title: Deep One Kassadin's VU is too soft.
body:
When I think of "the deep", I think of a dark and mysterious abyss.

The new Deep One Kassadin skin is kinda plain and boring. The actual model and animation update is really cool and I like it, but his texture for this skin just doesn't fit.

The deep green glow look of his old skin was really cool, and how it had those dark metallic colors. His skin tone was also darker giving him a more menacing look rather than someone who looks like they really need a tan.

I think his skin should be changd a bit, to keep it more close to its original look which is what people like it for.

-Change the light gray of his helmet and shoulder spines to a deep metallic blue

-Make his shoulders less than the bland color you get when you mix green and white

-Make the tentacles of his kilt a sharp glowing green, maybe with a darker background.

Though this will probably make the skin cost more, maybe make his purple void particles a deep green or maybe a deep blue color.


I really like his current skin's look and I feel that the new texture is more of a down grade(Especially after his gameplay downgrade). It is okay for a skin to have a shiny look riot, why not keep it?

Well I would be pissed if I bought a skin only to have it's colors changed in a way I didn't like. However, I think the new model looks great.

There is way more to modeling than polygon count.  Technology has existed for quite some time now that allows a game engine to render shading, textures, and effects at much higher resolutions than the polygon count would traditionally allow for, and doing so increases performance while maintaining and even improving graphics.

However, in spite of all that, they still managed to make this Kassadin VU suck :(  I mean nothing new? Really?  He's been one of the least visually appealing champions since... well since he was put in to the game really.
